channel.title: [PI]How to make a point system [basic]
channel.description:
Hello, Im just going to showw you how to make a point system without a shop, im bored so thats why im typing a tutorial.... Note: I will name the points: Summoning Points. Fist open player.java and under public int add:
summoningPoint,
Then open playersave.java and search for:
if (token.equals("character-height")) { p.heightLevel = Integer.parseInt(token2);
then under it add:
} else if (token.equals("SP")) { p.summoningPoint = Integer.parseInt(token2);
then searcch for:
characterfile.write("character-height = ", 0, 19); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.heightLevel), 0, Integer.toString(p.heightLevel).length()); characterfile.newLine();
And Under it add:
characterfile.write("SP = ", 0, 5); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.summoningPoint), 0, Integer.toString(p.summoningPoint).length()); characterfile.newLine();
Now if you want players to gain those points by doing something You should add:
c.summoningPoint += amount
Example: You want then to get the points by a levelup. then open playerassistant.java and search for:
Levelup(
Then if you want them to gain it from cooking Then your code would look like this:
case 7: sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just advanced a cooking level!", 6227); sendFrame126("Your cooking level is now "+getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[skill])+".", 6228); c.sendMessage("Congratulations, you just advanced a cooking level."); [b][color=red]c.summoningPoint += 1; c.sendMessage("And you recieved 1 Summoning Point!");[/b] sendFrame164(6226); break;
or if you would like to degrade the points use his code:
c.summoningPoint -= amount
The amount must be numberic only. Thanks for reading, Note: If this helped you, give me a rep please :)

item.title: [PI]How to make a point system [basic]
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

@Dayne

In your shopassistant class, search for public int getSpecialItemValue(int id) {

Then under switch (id) {
add

case ####: return %%%%;

is the item ID

%%%% is the amount of points

(I think that’s right. Not posotive though.)

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]How to make a point system [basic]
item.dc:creator: @Dayne Dayne
item.description:
@Dayne wrote:

I’m trying to make my “Mage Points” work on a PI based server.
Well, when you go to Mage Bank, Kolodoin, teleports you to the mage arena, and you kill battle mages for 1 point each.
You are supposed to redeem those points for items from the Chamber Guardian, but the Chamber Guardian SELLS the items that are supposed to be redeemed by the points. So instead of say, 30 points for an infinity top, it costs 4m.
Help would be appreciated.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]How to make a point system [basic]
item.dc:creator: @vince1234 vince1234
item.description:
@vince1234 wrote:

Hello, Im just going to showw you how to make a point system without a shop, im bored so thats why im typing a tutorial…

Note: I will name the points: Summoning Points.

Fist open player.java and under public int add:

summoningPoint,

Then open playersave.java and search for:

if (token.equals(“character-height”)) {
p.heightLevel = Integer.parseInt(token2);

then under it add:

} else if (token.equals("SP")) { p.summoningPoint = Integer.parseInt(token2);

then searcch for:

characterfile.write("character-height = ", 0, 19);
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.heightLevel), 0, Integer.toString(p.heightLevel).length());
characterfile.newLine();

And Under it add:

characterfile.write("SP = ", 0, 5); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.summoningPoint), 0, Integer.toString(p.summoningPoint).length()); characterfile.newLine();

Now if you want players to gain those points by doing something

You should add:

c.summoningPoint += amount

Example:

You want then to get the points by a levelup.

then open playerassistant.java and search for:

Levelup(

Then if you want them to gain it from cooking

Then your code would look like this:

case 7: sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just advanced a cooking level!", 6227); sendFrame126("Your cooking level is now "+getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[skill])+".", 6228); c.sendMessage("Congratulations, you just advanced a cooking level."); [b][color=red]c.summoningPoint += 1; c.sendMessage("And you recieved 1 Summoning Point!");[/b] sendFrame164(6226); break;

or if you would like to degrade the points use his code:

c.summoningPoint -= amount

The amount must be numberic only.

Thanks for reading,

Note: If this helped you, give me a rep please
